14   |  ** 									     **
15   |  **   Exports:		cmdSystem					     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Notes:		The Following code was written by Don Libes, NIST    **
18   |  **			It was taken from his tool, 'expect' ...	     **
19   |  **  			I have edited parts of it...			     **
20   |  ** 									     **

32   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };

41   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/

45   | 
46   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
47   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
48   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
49   | 
50   | #define MAX_ARGLIST 10240
51   | 
52   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
53   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
54   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
55   | 
56   | /** not applicable **/
57   | 
58   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
59   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
60   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
61   | 
62   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
63   | 
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
66   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
67   | 
68   | /** not applicable **/
69   | 
70   | 
71   | /*++++
72   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
73   |  ** 									     **
74   |  **   Function:		cmdSystem					     **
75   |  ** 									     **
76   |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'system'			     **
77   |  ** 									     **
78   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
79   |  ** 									     **
80   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
81   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
82   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
83   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
84   |  ** 									     **
85   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
86   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
87   |  ** 									     **
88   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
89   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
90   |  **					control everything		     **
91   |  ** 									     **
92   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
93   |  ++++*/
94   | 
95   | int cmdSystem(
96   | 	ClientData clientData,
97   | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
98   | 	int objc,
99   | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
100  | ) {
101  | 	int             saved_stdout,		/** save the stdout fd	     **/
102  | 	                total_len = 0,		/** total string length	     **/
103  | 			arg_len,		/** each arg string length   **/
104  | 			i;			/** loop counter	     **/
105  | 	char            buf[MAX_ARGLIST],	/** buffer for string to int **/
106  | 	               *bufp = buf;		/** buffer ptr		     **/
107  |     /**
108  |      **  Whatis mode
109  |      **/
110  | 	if (g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
111  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
112  |     /**
113  |      **  Display mode?
114  |      **/
115  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
116  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t\t ", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]));
117  | 		for (i = 1; i < objc; i++)
118  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(objv[i]));
119  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
120  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** -------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
121  | 	}
122  | 
123  |     /**
124  |      **  Prepare a buffer to hold the complete 'system' call
125  |      **  Watch over the commands complete length while copying ...
126  |      **/
127  | 	for (i = 1; i < objc; i++) {
128  | 		total_len += (1 + (arg_len = strlen(Tcl_GetString(objv[i]))));
129  | 		if (total_len > MAX_ARGLIST) {
130  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_ARGSTOLONG, LOC,
131  | 				Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
132  | 				(sprintf(buf, "%d", total_len), buf), NULL))
133  | 				return (TCL_ERROR); /** -- EXIT (FAILURE) -> **/
134  | 		}
135  | 
136  | 	/**
137  |  	 **  Copy the argument on the buffer and put a space at the end
138  | 	 **/
139  | 		memcpy(bufp, Tcl_GetString(objv[i]), arg_len);
140  | 		bufp += arg_len;
141  | 		memcpy(bufp, " ", 1);
142  | 		bufp += 1;
143  | 	}
144  | 
145  |     /**
146  |      **  For Modules, stdout must be directed to stderr so it
147  |      **  isn't parsed by the evaluating shell.  We also must save it here so it
148  |      **  can be restored after this command has been executed.
149  |      **/
150  | 	saved_stdout = TieStdout();
151  | 
152  | 	*(bufp - 1) = '\0';
153  | 	i = system(buf);
154  | 
155  |     /**
156  |      **  Following the style of Tcl_ExecCmd, we can just return the
157  |      **  raw result (appropriately shifted and masked) to Tcl
158  |      **/
159  | 	sprintf(buf, "%d", (0xff & (i >> 8)));
160  | 	Tcl_SetResult(interp, buf, TCL_VOLATILE);
161  | 
162  | 	/*
163  | 	 *  Restore stdout.
164  | 	 */
165  | 	UnTieStdout(saved_stdout);
166  | 
167  | 	return (TCL_OK);
168  | 
169  | } /** End of 'cmdSystem' **/
